name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

key_work.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018) picnic costumes
key_work.brief_description: Before their Valentine’s Day journey to Mt Diogenes, the students look pristine in these white dresses – picture-perfect young women ready to enter society. When the girls go missing, these once-innocent dresses take on an ethereal, intangible quality. As the students shed their gloves and boots, delving deeper into Mt Diogenes, they seem to disappear into the landscape while gaining a sense of freedom, wildness and mysterious purpose. “We’re here at last. We’ve escaped,” Miranda (Lily Sullivan) tells Ms McCraw (Anna McGahan) when they arrive. Through flashbacks and dream sequences, our perspective on their disappearance changes – is it a tragedy or an escape?

constellations_primary.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_primary.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

start.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
start.creator_credit: Véronique Cayla, Bénédicte Couvreur, Hold Up Films and Céline Sciamma
start.brief_description: On an isolated island in Brittany at the end of the eighteenth century, a female painter is obliged to paint a wedding portrait of a young woman.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

end.title: Titanic
end.creator_credit: James Cameron, Deborah Lynn Scott, Jon Landau, 20th Century Fox, Lightstorm Entertainment, Paramount, Peter Lamont and John Bruno
end.brief_description: 101-year-old Rose DeWitt Bukater tells the story of her life aboard the Titanic, 84 years later. A young Rose boards the ship with her mother and fiancé. Meanwhile, Jack Dawson and Fabrizio De Rossi win third-class tickets aboard the ship. Rose tells the whole story from Titanic’s departure through to its death—on its first and last voyage—on April 15, 1912.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

constellations_other.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_other.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

constellations_other.name: Quiet luxury, loud transformations
constellations_other.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

links.description: Director Céline Sciamma was inspired by Titanic (1997) in creating Portrait of a Lady on Fire (2019). Sciamma sees Titanic as a queer love story that, like her film, is told both in the present as well as recalled as a memory.

end.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
end.creator_credit: Véronique Cayla, Bénédicte Couvreur, Hold Up Films and Céline Sciamma
end.brief_description: On an isolated island in Brittany at the end of the eighteenth century, a female painter is obliged to paint a wedding portrait of a young woman.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

links.description: In Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018), Marion, Miranda and Irma pursue queer intimacies at the all-girls boarding school Appleyard College. Portrait of a Lady on Fire (2019) similarly situates the relationship between Héloïse and Marianne on a distant island without men.

start.title: Underwater
start.creator_credit: William Eubank, Dorotka Sapinska, Jenno Topping, Peter Chernin, Tonia Davis, 20th Century Fox, Chernin Entertainment, TSG Entertainment, Naaman Marshall, Adam Cozad and Brian Duffield
start.brief_description: After an earthquake destroys their underwater station, six researchers must navigate two miles along the dangerous, unknown depths of the ocean floor to make it to safety in a race against time.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

end.title: Alien
end.creator_credit: David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Ivor Powell and Walter Hill
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1979
end.brief_description: During its return to the earth, the spaceship Nostromo intercepts a distress signal from a distant planet. When the crew discovers a chamber containing thousands of eggs on the planet, the crew is unaware of the impending nightmare set to descend upon them…

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: Underwater (2020) is a homage to the science fiction horror classic, Alien (1979). Alongside an ensemble cast, both films focus on a female protagonist taking down a hostile creature in a claustrophobic setting.

end.title: Webwurld
end.credit_line:
Jess Johnson and Simon Ward

Single-channel video work

ACMI Collection
end.headline_credit: Aotearoa / New Zealand and United States, 2017
end.material_description: Soundtrack by Andrew Clarke. video, colour and audio
end.brief_description: Webwurld appears like fragments of a dream, mesmerising its viewers with a cosmic, otherworldly dimension that seems to stretch out in every direction.

constellations_primary.name: Webwurlds
constellations_primary.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

constellations_other.name: Speculative futures, sci-fi worlds and environmental disaster
constellations_other.description: Deborah Kelly's The Gods of Tiny Things explores extinction and the climate crisis, the scars of colonialism, and the political shift to the right around the world through collage and imagined futures, much like these sci-fi, animated and computer-generated artworks.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

links.description: The antagonist of Alien (1979) is the Xenomorph; a fictional extra-terrestrial species created by artist H R Giger. The Xenomorph is exemplary of Giger’s artistic style, which combined human bodies with machines. Jess Johnson’s Webwurld (2017) similarly explores the interconnections between technology and flesh.

links.description: The second half of Titanic (1997) plays out as a disaster film, centring on Rose and Jack navigating the sinking ship. The science fiction film Underwater (2020) is also a survival tale that takes place on the flooding vessel Kepler 822.

start.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018) picnic costumes

When the girls go missing, these once-innocent dresses take on an ethereal, intangible quality. end.title: Production design in Picnic at Hanging Rock
end.brief_description: This 2018 remake of the Australian New Wave classic reframes the story through the perspective of Mrs Appleyard, played by Natalie Dormer.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

links.description: It’s the little details handled by production designers that bring Appleyard College and the surrounding bush to live in Picnic at Hanging Rock, with these intimate objects just as important to the story and developing characters as costumes.
